title: Navigating the Top Menu in Globe3 Central ERP
intent: To understand the layout and functionality of the top menu in Globe3 Central ERP.
question: How to use the Top Menu?
answer: The Top Menu in Globe3 Central ERP is the primary horizontal navigation bar located at the top of the application window. It allows users to access different modules, functionalities, and system settings. To navigate, observe the main categories, interact with them to reveal sub-menus, and identify common utility icons like Home, Search, or User Profile.
description: The Top Menu in Globe3 Central ERP provides the primary navigation structure, allowing users to quickly access different modules, functionalities, and system settings. It is typically a horizontal bar situated at the uppermost part of the application window.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 Central ERP and a valid user login.
inputs: User needs to be logged into Globe3 Central ERP.
outputs: User successfully identifies and understands the main navigation elements in the top menu.
canonical_question: How do I navigate the top menu in Globe3 Central ERP?
alt_titles: Where is the main menu in Globe3 Central?

Identify major system modules or functional categories within the menu.
Interact with main menu items to reveal any dropdown sub-menus.
Look for common utility icons and links within the top menu area.
validations: The user can point out different sections of the top menu and describe their general purpose.
The user can successfully identify and open a sub-menu from a main top menu item.
pitfalls: Confusing the top menu with a side menu or context-specific menus.

title: Globe3 ERP Top Menu Components and Functions
intent: Understand Globe3 ERP navigation; Learn about the Top Menu elements; Identify key navigation components.
persona: New Globe3 ERP User, Regular User, System Administrator
question: What are the components of the Top Menu?
answer: The Globe3 ERP Top Menu is the primary navigation bar, located at the top of the interface. It provides quick access to essential system functions, including Logout, Site Map, Desktop, Links, My Favorites, Applications (via a select box), FYear (Fiscal Year), and Entity.
description: The Top Menu in Globe3 ERP serves as the main navigation interface, allowing users to access core functionalities and system information. It includes the following components: Logout, which enables users to securely exit the system and register a time-out; Site Map, which provides an outline view of all system processes; Desktop, which allows navigation back to the system's main page or desktop mode; Links, which displays a list of quick links to individual Globe3 applications, categorized by functional areas; My Favorites, an area where users can set personalized shortcuts to any section of Globe3 (new favorites can be added via the 'Organize Favorites' option); Applications, a select box used to scroll and access different applications and their modules; FYear (Fiscal Year), and Entity, which are used for selecting the relevant fiscal year and organizational entity, respectively.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP.
inputs: User interaction with the Globe3 ERP interface.
outputs: An understanding of the Globe3 ERP top-level navigation options and their basic functions.
not_about: Detailed steps for configuring specific applications
User role permissions for specific modules

title: Logging Out of Globe3 ERP
intent: To securely end a user session in Globe3 ERP and register a system timeout.
question: How do I use the Logout feature in Globe3 ERP?
answer: The Logout feature in Globe3 ERP allows users to securely end their session, which helps the system register a time out and ensures data security. It is accessed via an icon in the Top Menu.
description: The Logout feature is located in the Top Menu of Globe3 ERP. Clicking the logout icon terminates the current user session, enabling the system to register a time out and enhance security by preventing unauthorized access if the user steps away from their computer.
prerequisites: An active Globe3 ERP user session.
outputs: User session terminated; System registers time out; User is redirected to the login screen.
canonical_question: How do I log out of Globe3 ERP?
summary_steps: Locate the Top Menu.
Click the Logout icon.
validations: The system should display the login page or a session expired message.
Attempting to navigate within Globe3 ERP without logging in again should fail.
pitfalls: Forgetting to log out from a shared computer could expose sensitive data to unauthorized users.

title: Understanding Desktop Navigation and Components in Globe3 ERP
intent: Understand system navigation and interface components
question: What is the Desktop in Globe3 ERP?
answer: The Globe3 ERP Desktop serves as the main page and central navigation hub, allowing users to return to the primary system view. It provides direct access to various applications, reports, and personalized shortcuts via 'My Favorites'. Key sections accessible from or through the Desktop include Management Console, System Reports, Customer Center, and various modules like Purchase Invoice and Sales Order Project. The 'Applications Select Box' also allows scrolling through different functional areas and modules.
description: The Desktop in Globe3 ERP is the system's main page, designed for straightforward navigation and quick access to core functionalities. It consolidates various applications, reports, and user-defined shortcuts ('My Favorites') into a central interface. Users can return to this main view from anywhere in the system, and it facilitates exploration of different modules through directly listed items and the 'Applications Select Box' in the Top Menu.

title: How to Add a New Favorite to My Favorites List
intent: User wants to personalize their navigation in Globe3 ERP by adding shortcuts to frequently accessed sections.
question: How do I add a new favorite?
answer: To add a new favorite in Globe3 ERP, navigate to the 'My Favorites' section, click on 'Organize Favorites', check the 'Add' box, assign a name to your favorite, and then submit the entry. The new favorite will appear in your 'My Favorites' list.
description: This guide explains how to add a new personal shortcut, referred to as a 'Favorite', to your 'My Favorites' list in Globe3 ERP. This allows for quick access to frequently used sections of the system.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP with appropriate user permissions to modify personal settings.
outputs: New favorite successfully added to the 'My Favorites' list.
canonical_question: How do I add a new favorite to My Favorites in Globe3 ERP?
alt_titles: How to create a personal shortcut in Globe3
Setting up a custom favorite in Globe3 ERP
Adding a shortcut to My Favorites
summary_steps: Click 'Organize Favorites'.
Check the 'Add' box.
Assign a 'Favorite Name'.
Submit the entry.
validations: Verify that the newly added favorite appears in the 'My Favorites' list.
Confirm that clicking the new favorite navigates to the correct section of Globe3.
pitfalls: Forgetting to check the 'Add' box before submitting will prevent the favorite from being saved.
Using a non-descriptive 'Favorite Name' may make it difficult to identify the shortcut later.

steps.text: On the entry screen, check the 'Add' box.
steps.assert: The 'Add' box is checked, indicating a new favorite will be created.

steps.text: Assign a descriptive name to the favorite in the 'Favorite Name' field.
steps.assert: A name has been entered for the new favorite.

steps.text: Submit the entry to save the new favorite.
steps.assert: The new favorite is visible in the 'My Favorites' list.
steps.locator: Submit button
steps.result: The new favorite is added to your 'My Favorites' list.

title: Understanding and Using the Globe3 Applications Select Box
intent: To understand how to navigate and access different modules within the Globe3 ERP system using the Applications Select Box.
question: What is the Globe3 Applications Select Box and how do I use it to access modules?
answer: The Globe3 'Applications Select Box' is a navigation feature in the Top Menu that allows users to view and select from a comprehensive list of available modules and applications. To use it, locate the select box, scroll through the list, and left-click on the desired application.
description: The Globe3 ERP 'Applications Select Box' is a key navigation component located in the Top Menu. It provides a comprehensive list of all accessible modules and applications within the Globe3 system, organized in sub-folders. Users can scroll through this list and select an item to quickly navigate to that specific application. Examples of applications include Management Console, System Reports, Stock Item Inquiry, Customer Center, Vendor Center, Project Dashboard, My Setting, Organize Favorites, Bank Payment, Contact Management, Material Requisition, Purchase Invoice, Sales Invoice, and Stock Balances.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP; Appropriate user permissions for the desired application.
inputs: User selection from the Applications Select Box
outputs: Access to a specific Globe3 ERP module or application.
canonical_question: How do I view and navigate through the list of available applications and modules in Globe3 ERP?
summary_steps: Locate the Applications Select Box in the top menu.
Select an application from the dropdown list by left-clicking.
validations: The selected application's main interface or dashboard loads successfully.
The user is able to perform actions within the newly accessed application.
pitfalls: Misclicking the wrong application
Not seeing expected modules due to insufficient user permissions
Difficulty finding a specific application in a long list

title: How to Navigate and Select Applications and Modules Using the Applications Select Box
intent: To provide clear, step-by-step instructions on how to effectively use the Applications Select Box to access specific applications and modules within the Globe3 ERP system.
question: How do I use the Applications Select Box?
answer: To use the Applications Select Box in Globe3 ERP, locate it in the Top Menu, scroll through the list of available applications and their sub-folders for modules, then select and left-click on the desired application or module to open it.
description: The Applications Select Box is a crucial component of the Globe3 ERP Top Menu, designed to facilitate efficient navigation. It allows users to browse and select various applications and their associated modules, which are often grouped into sub-folders, to access different functionalities within the system.
prerequisites: Access to a running instance of Globe3 ERP and a valid user login. Appropriate user permissions are required to access specific applications and modules.
inputs: User interaction (scrolling through options, selecting an item, left-clicking on the selection)
outputs: The interface or main screen of the selected application or module is displayed, ready for user interaction.

answer: The My Favorites feature in Globe3 ERP is a personalization tool located in the Top Menu that allows users to create and manage personal shortcuts to any frequently accessed section or module within the system, thereby enhancing navigation efficiency and user experience.
description: The My Favorites feature in Globe3 ERP is a personalization tool located within the Top Menu. title: Managing Financial Years with the FYear Select Box in Globe3 ERP
intent: To provide clear instructions on how to effectively use the FYear Select Box in Globe3 ERP for viewing, modifying, and configuring financial year data, catering to both general users and administrators.
question: How do I use the FYear Select Box?
answer: The FYear Select Box in Globe3 ERP enables users to access and work with reports and records from different financial years. Users can toggle between financial years for data entry and report generation. Administrators have additional capabilities to set the default financial year when a new financial year is opened. The currently active financial year is always displayed in the top right section of the screen.
description: The FYear Select Box is a crucial component in Globe3 ERP, providing real-time access to financial data across different reporting periods. It allows users to effortlessly switch between financial years to perform data entry, generate reports, and review historical records. For administrators, this feature includes the important function of setting the default financial year, streamlining operations for new accounting periods.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP; Appropriate user permissions for viewing financial data and, for administrators, for setting default financial years.
inputs: Selection of a specific financial year from the FYear Select Box dropdown menu. Administrator input for setting the default financial year within system settings.
outputs: Display of the selected financial year; Access to financial reports and records specific to the chosen year; Successful recording of transactions for the active financial year; Configuration of a new default financial year by administrators.
source_section: Globe3 ERP User Manual >> Globe3 Central
canonical_question: How do I use the FYear Select Box in Globe3 ERP to manage financial years and access historical data?
alt_titles: How to change the active financial year in Globe3 ERP
Setting the default financial year in Globe3
Navigating financial years in Globe3 ERP for reports and transactions
summary_steps: Locate the FYear Select Box in the top right corner.
Click the dropdown and select the desired financial year.
Perform data entry or run reports within the context of the selected financial year.
Administrators: Set the default financial year for new periods via system administration.
validations: Always verify the currently active financial year displayed in the top right section of the screen before performing any data entry or running reports to ensure accuracy.
pitfalls: Operating in the incorrect financial year can lead to erroneous data entry or reports. Always verify the active year in the FYear Select Box before processing transactions or generating critical financial statements.

steps.text: Identify the 'FYear Select Box' located in the top right section of the Globe3 ERP screen.
steps.assert: Ensure you see the financial year displayed, confirming the box is present and active.
steps.locator: Top right section of the Globe3 ERP screen, labeled 'FYear Select Box'.
steps.result: The current active financial year is displayed within the select box.

steps.text: Click on the 'FYear Select Box' dropdown and choose the specific financial year you wish to access from the list.
steps.assert: Verify that the financial year displayed in the 'FYear Select Box' (top right) has changed to your selection and that corresponding reports/records load correctly.
steps.locator: Clickable dropdown of the 'FYear Select Box'.
steps.result: The system updates, and the data displayed on the screen now reflects information for the newly selected financial year.

steps.text: Proceed with data entry for transactions or run key financial reports, which will now apply to the currently selected financial year.
steps.assert: Confirm that all subsequent actions, such as saving a transaction or viewing a report, correctly utilize the data for the active financial year.
steps.result: Transactions are recorded and reports are generated within the context of the chosen financial year.

steps.text: For administrators: When a new financial year commences, navigate to the system administration module to set this new year as the default financial year for the system.
steps.assert: Log in as a standard user or verify through system settings that the newly opened default financial year is automatically active upon system access.
steps.result: The system is configured to automatically use the newly set default financial year for new operations.

steps.text: Perform data entry for transactions and run key financial reports for each financial year by toggling to the required year.

title: Accessing Different Company Records with the Entity Select Box in Globe3 ERP
intent: To allow users to change their active company context within the Globe3 ERP system to view and work with its specific records.
question: How can I use the Entity Select Box to change the active company in Globe3 ERP?
answer: To access records for a different company in Globe3 ERP, locate the 'Entity Select Box', click it to display the list of configured companies, and then select the desired company. The system will then display the records for the newly selected active company, which will be indicated in the center top section of the screen.
description: The 'Entity Select Box' in Globe3 ERP is a crucial feature for navigating its multi-company environment. It allows users to quickly switch between different company databases to access their respective records, financial data, and operational information. This functionality is essential for organizations managing multiple entities within a single Globe3 instance, providing real-time access to specific company data.
prerequisites: More than one company must be configured within the Globe3 ERP system. The user must possess the necessary access privileges to view and select different companies (refer to 'User Management' for details).
inputs: Clicking the 'Entity Select Box', selecting a company from the dropdown list.

title: How to Change the Display Language in Globe3 ERP
intent: The user wants to change the display language of the Globe3 ERP system.
question: How do I change the display language in Globe3 ERP?
answer: To change the display language in Globe3 ERP, locate the 'Languages Select Box' on the screen, click it, and then choose your desired language from the list (e.g., English, Chinese Simplified, Japanese). The entire interface will immediately translate to the selected language.
description: This guide explains how to change the user interface language in Globe3 ERP using the 'Languages Select Box'. Globe3 supports multiple languages, allowing users to switch their display preferences instantly.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP. The multi-lingual module must be enabled in the system configuration.
outputs: The Globe3 ERP user interface is translated into the selected language.

Confirm that all UI elements, including menus, labels, and system messages, appear correctly in the chosen language.

title: Overview of Globe3 ERP System Modules and Capabilities
intent: Understand the scope and functional areas of Globe3 ERP
persona: New User, System Administrator, Business Analyst, Project Manager, Stakeholder
question: Overview of Globe3 ERP Modules
answer:
The Globe3 ERP system is organized into several major functional modules that streamline various business operations. These modules are grouped under key categories to provide a comprehensive solution:

*   **Globe3 Central:** Includes Master Control, Company Control, Chart of Account, Forms & Printing, Admin Manager, Workflow Manager, General Code, Transaction Tracking, and Document Management.
*   **Supply Chain Management:** Covers Stock Master Control, Warehouse Manager, Inventory Control, Material Manager (Production), Sales Manager, Purchase Manager, Commodity Trading, Vessel Works Order, Field Service Manager, Lease Manager, Facilities Manager, Cylinder Tracking, RMA Manager, Collection Form, Credit Control Manager, Shipping Manager, OCR Module, and EDI Manager.
*   **CRM:** Features Calendar, Interaction/Ticket, Task Management, Marketing, Leads, Opportunities, and Sales Activity.
*   **Enterprise Project:** Encompasses Enterprise Project, Tender RQ, and Project Management.
*   **Human Resource:** Manages Employee, Payroll, Benefits Management, Workers, Transf. Staff, and Training & Development.
*   **Employee Self Service:** Provides Access Rights Manager, Expense Manager, Time Sheet Manager, Leave Management, Payroll Timesheet Manager, Performance Management, Payslip, Govt And Tax Forms, and Employee Data.
*   **Enterprise Portal:** Includes E-Submission.
*   **Enterprise Document Management:** Comprises EDM and OCR.
*   **Finance:** Covers SYS Admin, GL & AP, Cash Management, Cash Flow Projection, Consolidation Manager, Pro Forma Report Manager, Forex Risk Mgmt, Budget Manager, Fixed Asset Mgr, and Prepayment Mgr.
*   **MRP:** Deals with Configuration, Material Rqm Planning, Shop Floor Control, Production Planning, Quality Assurance, and Inventory Control.

Additionally, the system features global navigation tools such as the FYear Select Box for toggling financial years, the Entity Select Box for accessing different company records in a multi-company setup, and the Languages Select Box for selecting various language interfaces.
description: This section provides a comprehensive overview of the major functional modules within the Globe3 ERP system, outlining its extensive scope and capabilities across various business functions. It categorizes modules into areas such as Globe3 Central, Supply Chain Management, CRM, Enterprise Project, Human Resource, Employee Self Service, Enterprise Portal, Enterprise Document Management, Finance, and MRP, defining the overall system architecture.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of ERP systems (beneficial but not required).
outputs: A high-level understanding of Globe3 ERP's modular structure and its capabilities.

title: Controlling Multi-Company Visibility and Access via User Privileges
intent: To understand how user access privileges govern the visibility and selection of companies in a multi-company environment.
persona: System Administrator, Administrator, User Manager, IT Support
question: How does user management control access to multiple companies?
answer: In Globe3's multi-company system, the visibility and access to different companies in the 'Entity Select Box' are controlled by user access privileges. Administrators configure these privileges within the 'User Management' module to determine which companies a user can see and access.
description: This concept explains how user access privileges are fundamental to controlling which companies are displayed and accessible via the 'Entity Select Box' in the Globe3 multi-company system. When more than one company is set up, the list of available companies for selection is dynamically filtered based on the logged-in user's configured access rights, which are managed in the 'User Management' module. This mechanism is crucial for maintaining data security and operational segregation across different entities within the ERP.
prerequisites: Administrator access to the Globe3 ERP system, familiarity with the 'User Management' module, understanding of organizational company structures.
outputs: The user interface showing only the companies permitted by the user's access privileges.
canonical_question: How are company listings in the Entity Select Box controlled for users?
alt_titles: Managing Company Access in Globe3 Multi-Company System
Controlling Company Listings through User Management
How User Access Controls Company Visibility
validations: Verify that users can only view and access companies for which they have explicit permission.
Confirm that users without specific company access do not see those companies in the 'Entity Select Box'.
pitfalls: Incorrectly configured user privileges leading to unauthorized access to company data.
Users being unable to access required companies due to insufficient privileges.
Security breaches if user access controls are not properly maintained.

title: Understanding Main Transaction and Forms Navigation Options in Globe3 ERP
intent: To provide a comprehensive understanding of the main transaction and forms navigation options available in Globe3 ERP, enabling users to efficiently access different functionalities.
question: What are the main navigation options available in Globe3 ERP transaction and forms sections?
answer: The main navigation links in Globe3 ERP transaction and forms sections are typically located near the top right of the screen. These links include 'Prelim' for preliminary pages, 'New' for entering new records, 'List' for viewing existing records, 'Report' for generating specific reports, 'Admin' for administrative settings, 'Print' for printing documents, 'Search' for advanced search, and '(M)' for viewing the Process Map.
description: This guide explains the primary navigation links found near the top right of the screen in most Globe3 ERP transaction and forms sections, detailing their purpose and function.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP transaction forms.
outputs: Display of specific pages or functionalities within Globe3 ERP (e.g., new record form, list of records, report interface, admin settings, search results, process map).
not_about: Specific icon functions within record listings
canonical_question: How do I navigate transactions and forms in Globe3 ERP?
alt_titles: Where are the primary navigation options in Globe3 ERP?
Explaining Globe3 ERP form navigation buttons
summary_steps: Locate the main navigation links (Prelim, New, List, Report, Admin, Print, Search, M) near the top right of Globe3 ERP transaction screens.

Click the desired link to access specific functionalities such as displaying preliminary pages, entering new records, listing existing records, generating reports, configuring administrative settings, printing documents, performing advanced searches, or viewing the process map.

steps.text: Click the 'Prelim' link to display the preliminary page for the current transaction.
steps.assert: The user sees the preliminary page for the transaction.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'Prelim'
steps.result: The system displays the preliminary page.

steps.text: Click the 'New' link to enter new records for the current transaction module.
steps.assert: The user sees a blank form to enter new data.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'New'
steps.result: The system opens a new record entry form.

steps.text: Click the 'List' link to view a list of all or the most recent records, depending on the system's configuration.
steps.assert: The user sees a list of existing records with various columns and icons.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'List'
steps.result: The system displays a listing of records (e.g., bank payment).

steps.text: Click the 'Report' link to generate specific transactional reports for the module.
steps.assert: The user sees options to create or view reports.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'Report'
steps.result: The system navigates to the reporting interface for the module.

steps.text: Click the 'Admin' link to access administrative settings such as auto numbering, taps, and document lock/unlock functionalities.
steps.assert: The user can configure auto-numbering, taps, or document lock/unlock settings.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'Admin'
steps.result: The system displays the administrative settings page for the module.

steps.text: Click the 'Print' link to print documents based on a specified date range.
steps.assert: The user can specify a date range and print documents.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'Print'
steps.result: The system opens the print dialog or report generation tool.

steps.text: Click the 'Search' link to use the advanced search function specific to the current sub-module.
steps.assert: The user can input criteria for an advanced search within the sub-module.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled 'Search'
steps.result: The system displays an advanced search interface.

steps.text: Click the '(M)' link to view the Process Map, which provides a visual overview of workflows.
steps.assert: The user sees a graphical representation of the module's processes.
steps.locator: Top right portion of the screen, link labeled '(M)'
steps.result: The system displays the Process Map.

title: Globe3 ERP List View Column Icons and Their Functions
intent: To identify and understand the function of each icon present in the Globe3 ERP record list view.
question: What do the icons in the Globe3 ERP list view signify?
answer: The Globe3 ERP List View uses various icons to represent actions and statuses such as deleting records, editing documents, viewing entries, tracking history, previewing print forms, attaching documents, cloning, voiding, viewing GL double entries, checking workflow status, and editing document numbers.
description: This document outlines the functions of the various icons displayed in the column headers and individual record rows within the Globe3 ERP List View, helping users understand how to interact with records for actions like deletion, editing, viewing details, and status tracking.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 ERP and a list view of records (e.g., Bank Payment, Petty Cash, Bank Receipt).
inputs: A Globe3 ERP record list view displaying various records and associated action icons.
outputs: A clear understanding of the purpose and action associated with each icon in the Globe3 ERP list view.
source_section: 1.2 Icons, 1.3 Transaction / Forms Navigation, List View Icons Description (Pages 10, 11, 12)
not_about: Icons in transaction forms other than list view

summary_steps: The Bin icon (first column) is for deleting the record.
The Pencil icon (second column) provides a link to edit the document.
The Telescope icon (third column) is for viewing the detailed record entry.
The Gear icon is used for tracking the document's history.
The Magnifying glass icon (often beside a Name field) is for print form preview.
validations: Confirm the icon's visual appearance matches the description.
Verify functionality by attempting the action (e.g., clicking edit, if enabled).
pitfalls: An icon's functionality (e.g., delete, edit) might be disabled or unavailable for certain records due to system controls or permissions.
The appearance of the cursor (e.g., hand shape) indicates whether an edit link is active.

title: Globe3 ERP System Icons Reference
intent: To provide a clear reference for users to understand the purpose and functionality of various icons in the Globe3 ERP system.
persona: Globe3 ERP User, System Administrator, Data Entry Clerk, Manager
question: What do the different icons in Globe3 ERP mean and what are their functions?
answer: The Globe3 ERP system utilizes a variety of icons to represent functions and statuses across its interface, including forms and list views. Key icons and their functions include: Delete (Bin icon) for removing records (unavailable if a checkbox is missing due to control purposes); Edit (Pencil icon) for modifying documents (indicated by a hand cursor on hover); Activate/Deactivate Column for managing column visibility; Activate/Deactivate Status for toggling item statuses; Enter New for creating new records; View Entry Mode (Telescope icon) for inspecting record details; Workflow Approval Status (Person outline in a square icon) for checking workflow progression; Void Status (Recycle/void icon with X) for invalidating records; View Print (Magnifying glass beside Name) for print previews; Email for sending documents; Set Letterhead On/Off for letterhead display; and Add Row for inserting new table rows. Additional icons often found in list views include: Gear image icon for document history tracking; Paperclip icon for attaching documents; Two overlapping squares icon for cloning records; Document with two horizontal lines icon for viewing GL double entries; Document with a checkmark icon for multiple print views; and Scissors icon for editing document numbers.
description: This section provides a comprehensive reference of icons used throughout the Globe3 ERP system, detailing their functions for various actions such as record management, document viewing, and system operations within forms and list views.
prerequisites: Basic familiarity with the Globe3 ERP interface.
outputs: N/A

pitfalls: Misinterpreting an icon's function, leading to unintended actions.
Attempting actions (e.g., delete, edit) on records that are not enabled for those operations, as indicated by missing UI elements or cursor changes.

errors.fix: Records without a delete checkbox cannot be deleted for control purposes.
errors.issue: Attempting to delete a record when the checkbox is not showing.

errors.fix: The record is not editable if the hand cursor does not appear when hovering over the link.
errors.issue: Attempting to edit a record when the mouse cursor does not change to a Hand shape.

title: Managing Master Users and Access Privileges in Globe3 ERP
intent: To guide administrators through the process of creating and configuring master-level users, assigning company access and privileges in Globe3 ERP.
question: How do I create and manage master-level users and their access privileges in Globe3 ERP?
answer: To manage master users in Globe3 ERP, navigate to Master Users Management. First, identify if the user is from the Human Resources Employees module or needs to be created anew. Configure employee categories if applicable, then choose whether to create the user from a template or from scratch, defining application access. Proceed to assign the user's type, role, company, login credentials, and validity period. Finally, fine-tune their access privileges to specific companies and functions, with an option to save these settings as a reusable user access template.
description: This guide outlines the process for master administrators to create new master-level users, assign their company access, define privileges, and optionally save these settings as a reusable template within Globe3 ERP.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 Central, Master Administrator privileges in Globe3 ERP. Optionally, an existing employee record in the Human Resource application's Employees module.
inputs: Employee name (optional), subsidiary company, user categories (Sales, Purchase, etc.), user template (optional), applications access (view only/full access), User Type, System Role, Company, Login ID, Password, Validity Period, specific company/function privileges, template name for saving.
outputs: A new master-level user created with assigned privileges, or an updated user access template.
source_section: Globe3 Central > Master Control > Master Settings > Master Users Mgmt
not_about: Detailed employee record creation in the HR Employees module
Comprehensive overview of all available user privileges
canonical_question: How do I create and manage master-level users and their access privileges in Globe3 ERP?
alt_titles: How to add a new master user in Globe3 ERP
Configuring user access for master users
Setting up master user accounts and roles
Granting company access to master users
summary_steps: Navigate to Master Users Management.
Determine the user's source (HR Employees module or new) and handle staff name selection.
Assign employee categories like sales or purchase executive if applicable.
Select user creation method (template or scratch) and configure application access (view only/full access).
Assign User Type, System Role, Company, Login ID, Password, and Validity Period.
Fine-tune specific company and function access privileges.
Optionally, save the configured settings as a reusable User Access Template.
validations: Verify that the new master user can log in with the assigned credentials.
Confirm that the user has the correct access rights to the specified companies and functions.
Ensure the user does not have unauthorized access beyond their assigned privileges.
pitfalls: Incorrect privilege assignment leading to unauthorized access or restricted functionality for the user
Failing to save a user access template when similar configurations will be needed for future users

steps.text: Navigate to the Master Users Management screen.

Determine the source of the new master user. If the user already exists in the Human Resource application's Employees module, ensure their record is established in the group/parent company and specify their subsidiary company. If the user is not in the Employee database, check the designated checkbox to bypass staff name selection.
ui_labels: checkbox to bypass selecting staff name

steps.text: If the user is an employee and needs specific categorization (e.g., as a sales or purchase executive), click on the 'Categories' tab and select the relevant department checkboxes.

Choose how to create the user: from an existing template or from scratch. If creating from a template, select the applicable template name and leave the 'Default Settings' section blank. If creating from scratch, check the 'Selected' box for each application the user will access, and specify whether their access is 'view only' or 'full access'.
Assign the new user's essential details: 'User Type', 'System Role', associated 'Company', 'Login ID', 'Password', and 'Validity Period'.
Refine the new user's access privileges by configuring specific companies and functions they are authorized to use. Refer to the user privilege access matrix for guidance.

title: Creating New Master Users: Employee Data Integration, Templates, and Manual Setup in Globe3 ERP
intent: To create new master-level users in Globe3 ERP with appropriate access privileges.
persona: Master Administrator, System Administrator, IT Manager
question: How do I create a new master user in Globe3 ERP?
answer: Master users in Globe3 ERP can be created either by integrating existing employee data from the Human Resources module (if the user is from a group/parent company and subsidiary) or by bypassing employee selection if the user is not in the employee database. Users can be set up from a template or from scratch, involving assigning User Type, System Role, Company, Login ID, Password, and access privileges, with an option to save these settings as a template for future use.
description: This guide details the two primary methods for initiating master user creation in Globe3 ERP: either by integrating with existing employee data from the Human Resources module (requiring the user to be created in the group/parent company and specifying their subsidiary) or by bypassing employee data selection if the user is not in the system's employee database. It also covers creating users from a template versus a manual setup from scratch, and the subsequent assignment of user roles, company access, login credentials, and fine-tuning privileges, with the option to save these settings as a user access template for future use.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 Central > Master Control > Master Settings > Master Users Mgmt; Master Administrator privileges; Employee data created in the HR module for users to be integrated.
inputs: Employee name (if integrating from HR), subsidiary company, staff name (if not bypassing), user type, system role, company, login ID, password, validity period, application access settings (view only/full access), template name (if using), user access template name (if saving).
outputs: A new master user account created in Globe3 ERP with defined access privileges; Optionally, a new user access template saved.
not_about: Detailed employee data management beyond creation link
General system administration not related to user creation
canonical_question: How do I create a new master user in Globe3 ERP, including options for employee data integration, using templates, or manual setup?
alt_titles: How to set up a new master user in Globe3 ERP
Setting up user access templates in Globe3 ERP
summary_steps: Navigate to Master Users Management.
Choose between employee data integration or bypassing staff selection.
Select to create a user from a template or from scratch.
Configure application access (if creating from scratch).
Assign user type, system role, company, login ID, password, and validity period.
Fine-tune specific company and function access.
(Optional) Save settings as a user access template.
validations: Verify the new user can log in with the assigned credentials.
Confirm the new user has the correct level of access to applications, companies, and functions.
Check if the saved user access template appears in the list for future use (if created).
pitfalls: Granting excessive privileges inadvertently, posing security risks.
Forgetting to specify the subsidiary company when integrating with employee data, leading to incorrect user association.
Not saving frequently used access settings as a template, resulting in repetitive setup for multiple users.
Misunderstanding the difference between creating from the employee module vs. bypassing, leading to workflow errors.

errors.fix: Ensure the employee is created in the HR Employees module first, or check the 'Bypass staff selection' checkbox if the user is not in the database.
errors.issue: User not found in Employee database when attempting to select staff.

errors.fix: Refer to the user privilege access matrix and carefully fine-tune access down to specific companies and functions to avoid over-privileging or under-privileging.

title: Saving and Applying User Access Templates
intent: To provide instructions on how to save user access settings as a reusable template and how to apply an existing template when creating new users in Globe3 ERP.
question: Saving and Applying User Access Templates for Efficient User Provisioning
answer: You can save user access settings as a template and apply it to new users by first configuring a user's access, checking 'Save as User Access Template' and naming it, then later selecting this template when creating new users.
description: This guide details the process of creating reusable user access templates in Globe3 ERP. These templates store predefined access privileges, streamlining the provisioning of new master-level users by ensuring consistency and reducing manual configuration efforts.
prerequisites: Access to Globe3 Central > Master Control > Master Settings > Master Users Mgmt. Master-level administrator privileges.
inputs: User access settings (User Type, System Role, Company, Login ID, Password, Validity Period, specific company/function privileges), Template Name.
outputs: Saved User Access Template; New user created with predefined access settings.
source_section: Globe3 ERP User Manual >> Globe3 Central, Section 2.1 Master Users Management (Pages 13-15)
canonical_question: How do I save user access settings as a template and apply it to new users in Globe3 ERP?
alt_titles: Create and Reuse User Access Profiles
Streamline User Provisioning with Access Templates
summary_steps: Navigate to Master Users Management.
Configure user access settings.
Check "Save as User Access Template" and assign a name.
Save the user configuration.
To apply: Select "Create from Template" when adding a new user.
Choose the desired template from the list.
Finalize new user creation; access settings will be applied automatically.
validations: The saved template appears in the list of available templates for selection.
A newly created user using a template has the correct access privileges as defined by that template.
Confirm that the 'Default Settings' section is blank when creating a user from a template, indicating successful template application.
pitfalls: Incorrect privileges assigned if the template is not configured correctly.
Potential security risks if templates grant excessive access.
Overwriting existing user settings if applied incorrectly during an update instead of creation.

title: Create New Users Using User Access Templates in Globe3 ERP
intent: To quickly create new user accounts with predefined access rights using User Access Templates in Globe3 ERP.
question: How can I quickly generate new users with predefined access rights using templates in Globe3 ERP?
answer: To quickly generate a new user with predefined access rights in Globe3 ERP, navigate to the 'New' page under Master Users Management, select an applicable User Access Template, and then modify any specific user details as required before saving.
description: This guide explains how to efficiently create new user accounts in Globe3 ERP by leveraging pre-configured User Access Templates. Templates streamline the user creation process, especially for users requiring similar access rights, such as those in specific departments (e.g., Accounts, Purchasing, Sales). Multiple templates can be saved and reused for different user profiles.
prerequisites: Access to the 'MASTER USERS MGMT' section within the Globe3 ERP System Administration module. Existing User Access Templates must be configured in the system. Sufficient permissions to create new users.
inputs: Existing User Access Template; specific details for the new user (e.g., name, login ID, password, department if different from template).
outputs: A newly created user account with access rights based on the selected template and any customized details.
not_about: Creating a user from scratch without a template
canonical_question: How do I create new users using a user access template in Globe3 ERP?
alt_titles: How to Create Users from a Template in Globe3 ERP
Using User Access Templates for New Users in Globe3 ERP
Generate Users via Templates in Globe3 ERP
summary_steps: Navigate to the 'New' user creation page under 'Master Users Management'.
Select an appropriate User Access Template.
Click 'Next' to proceed.
Modify any specific user details as needed.
Save the new user.
validations: Verify the newly created user's access rights by logging into Globe3 ERP with the new credentials.
Confirm that the user details (e.g., name, department, role) are correctly updated in the user's profile.
Check the user list to ensure the new user account appears and is active.
pitfalls: Selecting an incorrect template which grants unintended or insufficient access rights.
No suitable user access templates are configured, requiring manual setup or template creation before proceeding.
Forgetting to customize specific details after selecting a template, leading to generic or incorrect user profiles for the new user.

errors.fix: Verify the selected template and ensure it grants the required access profile. If no suitable template exists, create a new one or modify an existing one to match the needs.
errors.issue: Incorrect user access rights are assigned after creation.

errors.fix: Ensure all mandatory user details are filled in before attempting to save the new user. Review system error messages for specific missing fields.
errors.issue: Failed to save the new user due to missing mandatory information.

steps.result: The chosen User Access Template is internally selected and its default settings are prepared for the new user.

steps.assert: The system proceeds to the next step, typically a form for entering or reviewing specific user details.
steps.locator: Next button
steps.result: The user details page is loaded, pre-filled with information from the selected template.

steps.text: Change the details as required to customize the new user's profile.
steps.assert: All necessary user details, including any customized fields, are correctly entered and ready for final submission.
steps.locator: User details form fields (e.g., User ID, User Name, Password, Email, Department, Role)
steps.result: The new user's specific information is updated, overriding any template defaults as required.

title: System Administration Functions in Globe3 ERP Finance Module
intent: Understand the scope and specific functions of System Administration within the Globe3 ERP Finance module.
persona: System Administrator, Finance Manager, ERP Administrator
question: What functions are under SYS ADMIN in Globe3 ERP Finance?
answer: The System Administration (SYS ADMIN) functions in the Globe3 ERP Finance module are categorized into PROCESS, CUSTOM EXPORT, and CUSTOM IMPORT. PROCESS functions include: Lock Document, Unlock Document, GL Recur Batch Processing, GL Batch Posting, GL Checking, Transaction Batch Posting, Transaction Batch Delete, and Lock GL Opening Function. CUSTOM EXPORT options allow for exporting Contact, GL, AP, and AR Records. CUSTOM IMPORT options currently support importing AR Records.
description: This section provides an overview of the System Administration (SYS ADMIN) functions available within the Globe3 ERP Finance module. It details various process management tools, custom data export options, and custom data import capabilities, which are essential for managing financial operations and data within Globe3 ERP.

CUSTOM IMPORT options include: AR Record.

title: Globe3 ERP Finance: GL AR AP Module Functions Overview
intent: To inform users about the available functions within the GL AR AP section of the Globe3 ERP Finance module.
persona: Finance User, System Administrator, Accountant, Auditor
question: What functions are available under the GL AR AP section in the Globe3 ERP Finance module?
answer: The GL AR AP section within the Globe3 ERP Finance module provides two main categories of functions: GL Opening Balance and GL Import and Export. GL Opening Balance functions include Conversion Date, Enter Balance, and Review. GL Import and Export functions include Upload Source File, Verify External Data (Complex), Import External Data (Complex), and Import External Data (Control).
description: This knowledge item provides an overview of the core functions available under the GL AR AP (General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable) section of the Finance module in Globe3 ERP. It outlines features related to managing opening balances and facilitating data import and export operations for general ledger records.

title: Managing User Access with Multiple Templates in Globe3 ERP
intent: Understand and utilize the capability to manage user access efficiently using multiple templates in Globe3 ERP.
question: Can I save and use multiple user access templates for different roles in Globe3 ERP?
answer: Globe3 ERP allows administrators to create and save multiple user access templates. These templates can be tailored for different roles or departments, such as Accounts, Purchasing, or Sales, enabling quick and consistent assignment of access rights when creating new users.
description: Globe3 ERP provides the flexibility to save numerous user access templates. This feature allows system administrators to define distinct access profiles for various roles (e.g., Accounts, Purchasing, Sales) and rapidly apply these predefined settings when generating new user accounts, streamlining the user provisioning process and ensuring consistent permissions.
prerequisites: Access to the 'MASTER USERS MGMT' section and understanding of required user access profiles for different roles.
inputs: User roles and their required access rights, existing user access templates, new user details.
outputs: Streamlined user creation process, consistent application of access rights across different user roles.
